Header:
An interactive demo of a Light-Seq dataset from our paper.
https://www.nature.com/articles/s41592-022-01604-1

Use the mouse wheel to zoom in to regions of interest.
Visualize different channels with the "Channel Group" sidebar on the right.

Waypoints.Name: Overview
Waypoints.Description:
Here we start with an overview of the mouse retina with all channels displayed. We demonstrate the power of Light-Seq by targeting a rare cell in the retina called Tyrosine Hydroxylase, TH+ dopaminergic amacrine cells (TH+ DACs).

The nuclei is stained with DAPI (blue). The TH+ DAC cells are stained with an antibody (orange). Region barcodes targeting the adjacent amacrine cells TH- ACs (green) and, the TH+ DAC cells (magenta).

Waypoints.Name: Rare TH+ DAC cell identification
Waypoints.Description: Here we can see one example of a TH+ DAC cell. The retina was pre-stained with a Tyrosine Hydroxylase (TH) antibody to identify all the TH+ expressing cells.

Waypoints.Name: All Rare cells
Waypoints.Description: In this particular retina section, we only have 6 TH+ DAC cells, illustrating its extreme rarity.

Waypoints.Name: Barcode TH+ Cells
Waypoints.Description: Here we barcoded the TH+ cell with one of our DNA barcode sequences (Magenta).

Waypoints.Name: TH barcode plus TH stain
Waypoints.Description: Overlaying the barcode signal with the TH+ stain, we can see that it very closely matches the cell outline.

Waypoints.Name: Adjacent cell barcoding
Waypoints.Description:
To look at the differential genes expressed in TH+ cells, we barcoded the adjacent amacrine cells with another DNA barcode (green).

We find over 30+ differentially expressed genes in the TH+ cells compared to the adjacent TH- amacrine cells.
